root: ^I realize that eventually I'm going to have to get up again. My legs are so tired I don't even want to walk to my care.
^But ahs your day at least been good still?
^Oh is this for your paper? Sorry, I mean yes! I've had a wonderful day.
^You don't have to pretend with me.
^But I'm not pretending! I really have had a great day here.
^My legs are tired because I've been going around and enjoying things.
^It's great and all, but sometimes I feel like an absent parent, letting her ride that coaster all day.
^I think your're being hard on yourself. She's having a good time, isn't she?
^Sure, but she's having a good time with the coaster, not with me.
^I see. But you were the one who broguht her here, right? You let her reach the thing she wanted to do.
^And even if you don't spend much time with her here, try talking with her in the car. let her know you care.
^No, it's okay! Just don't let solving other people's problems get in the way of solving your own.
^You've had hard days too, haven't you?
